result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .81. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .81 was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason T. Jones was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:15 p.m. Defendant Jason T. Jones in court.  Defendant statement to recently obtained employment, and need for surgery within next week. Requests additional date. Court expects regular payments as soon as defendant returns to work. Defendant requests $50 monthly payment plan to begin on June 1st. Court approves $50 monthly payment until defendant is employed. Adj. 4:18 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant
Review hearing on May 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Deft is incarcerated until March 2017, per Judge his fine payment will be extended until after his release. Review date set for 5/1/2017 @ 3:00 p.m.
Associated with Charge #1

10:59 a.m. Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Koppelman/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
Jail - 6 months with Huber for all purposes.  To commence within 100 days.
Jail credit - 2 days if revoked
Fine - $600 plus costs
Driver's License revocation - 2 years
IID - 12 months
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA Assessment and follow-through
Driver's Safety Plan
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:12 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:19
Day 2 of Trial
Court statement to instruction discussion - Koppleman statement - offers defense ex 6 (2 alternate jury instructions) - received - Court further statement Koppleman continuing objection noted by Court - instructions to be given -100,103,140,145,2663,2660C,2621,1795,148,157,170,190,195,200,300,160 ,460,515, verdict forms -  Counsel stipulates with exception of previous objection by Koppleman.
8:30 - Jurors in - Instructions given to jurors - 
8:47 - Closing argument - Schiek - 
9:02- Closing argument - Koppleman - 
9:27 - Rebuttal - Schiek 
9:30 - remaining instructions/verdict given to jury-
9:34  Bailiff's sworn - jurors released for deliberation -  discussion in regards to exhibits to jurors- Schiek statement - Koppleman statement - all exhibits to be held unless requested by jury - recess 9:39
11:50 - Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with Attorney James Koppelman. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states question from jury - Schiek/Koppelman - no objection.  Discussion concerning lunch for jurors- Court directs baliff to provide Exhibit 1 to jurors and inquire of lunch. No lunch required. Recess 11:54
12:05 - Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 12:07 - Jurors return - Court asks jury foreman if verdict has been reached - Verdict provided to Judge. 
Verdict - Count 1 - guilty, Count 2 - guilty, Count 3 - not guilty, Count 4 - not guilty 
Foreman confirms signature and verdicts. Court polls jury. Court thanks jury for service. Jurors excused but asked to remain in jury room - 12:12 p.m.
Schiek/Koppelman statement to judgment of acquital. Court grants judgment of acquital in Counts 3 and 4. Court does not revoke bond at this time. Sentencing hearing to be scheduled. Koppelman may file motions and will be heard at sentencing. Bond continued. Adj. 12:15 p.m.
Notice of motion, motion, and coverletter
Juror question

1:14 p.m. Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Koppelman states witness C.R.  is present in courtroom - there has been no request for sequestration - Court allows witness C.R. to remain in courtroom - 1:16 pm Jurors return. Deputy Blondheim recalled - Court reminds witness he is still under oath - direct by Schiek/Exhibit 1 shown to witness - Side bar - Cross by Koppelman - Side bar - Continued cross by Koppelman - Juror question of witness - reviewed by Schiek/Koppelman - no objections - Court presents question to witness - Koppelman follow-up to juror question - Deputy Blondheim excused. Jury excused at 1:42 p.m. Court statement to Koppelman line of questioning - side bar details put on record. Schiek/Koppelman statement to Court description of side bar. Recess at 1:47 p.m. to allow review of DVD played with audio. On record 2:00 p.m. Court asks Koppelman if he has any concerns or questions concerning video with audio - Koppelman states that ambient noise reduction is fine and that off camera discussion between officers is still not audible. Court states he has brought up Lincoln County case on judicial dashboard - can see that bond only contains check next to no contact provision - Court recites court minutes from bond hearing. Court finds that no contact provision and standard pre-printed provisions are conditions of bond. 2:09 pm - Jurors return - Court statement to jurors regarding DVD played previously. DVD played with audio turned on. Video stopped at 3:27:58. Deputy Blondheim recalled - Court reminds still under oath. Koppelman exam of Blondheim. Deputy Blondheim excused. Schiek calls Michelle Gee/sworn/direct by Schiek - Exhibit 5 (lab report) - marked /Schiek moves to put Exhibits 1 -5 into evidence - Granted/ Cross by Koppelman - Schiek moves to release witness from subpoena - Granted. State rests. Jurors excused 1:47 p.m. Discussion regarding bail jumping charge - Koppelman will not make motion at this time. Koppelman states defendant will testify.  Court reads on waiver of right to testify - Court finds that waiver to remain silent free and voluntary. State asserts there are 4 prior OWI cases (one not criminal) with additional convictions for other crimes - Koppelman does not dispute any of those convictions - Koppelman statement to admission of traffic matters. Court finds that Wood County case and Price County cases are admissible -  Recess 3:02 p.m. On record 3:17 p.m. Court/Schiek/Koppelman discussion regarding defense case/jury instruction. Jurors return at 3:20 p.m. Koppelman calls C.R./sworn/direct by Koppelman/cross by Schiek/redirect by Koppelman -Koppelman moves to release witness from subpoena. Koppelman calls Defendant Jason Jones/sworn/direct by Koppelman - witness shown Exhibit 1 /cross by Schiek/redirect by Koppelman. Defense rests. Jurors excused at 4:10 p.m. to return by Thursday 8:20 a.m. Recess at 4:12 p.m. Informal jury instruction conference.

In Chambers - Defendant Jason T. Jones in chambers with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek for State of Wisconsin in chambers. Koppelman/Schiek/Court statements on defendant's Motion in Limine - Court denies motion. Court statement to preliminary instructions to jury. Schiek/Koppelman stipulate to defendant on bond in Lincoln County (felony) at the time Oneida County charges were filed; Koppelman stipulates that license was revoked - Koppelman/Defendant stipulate to 3 priors; Parties stipulate as to preliminary instruction language as to premises as provided by Judge. Discussion as to video evidence - Court finds if any discussion regarding results of PBT are audible - those results are not admissable - Court suggests mute audio during PBT discussions. Schiek states Todd Mohr will be called first - has travel plans for today - Koppelman stipulates to order of witness. Parties stipulate that no alternate jurors are necessary. 8:46 a.m. 

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:56 a.m. Case called - all jurors sworn  - 20 jurors drawn
9:04 a.m. - Introduction of counsel - Schiek
9:05 a.m. - Introduction of counsel - Koppelman
9:06 a.m. - Voir Dire - Court 
9:13 a.m. - Voir Dire - Schiek 
9:21 a.m. - Voir Dire - Koppelman 
Juror 1552 Excused for cause - #1594 drawn, Continued Voir Dire by Koppelman
9:39 a.m. Peremptory strikes commencing 
9:45 a.m. - 12 jurors selected/sworn to serve on trial
9:48 a.m. - Jurors excused - Discussion regarding jury instructions - State's Exhibit 1 (Lincoln County bond) and Exhibit 2 (Certified driving record) received.
Recess 9:57 a.m. On record 10:11 a.m.
10:14 a.m. - Jurors return - Preliminary instructions to jury
10:27 a.m. - Opening statement - Schiek - 10:35 a.m. - Opening statement - Koppelman - Pens/paper provided to jurors for note taking purposes
State calls Todd Mohr/sworn/direct by Schiek - Exhibit 3 (aerial photograph) marked - Side bar - continue direct exam - Cross by Koppelman - Redirect by Schiek - Witness released from subpoena
State calls Oneida County Detective Sargeant Chad Wanta/sworn/direct by Schiek  - Parties stipulate as to Defendant's ID - Cross by Koppelman - Juror question to Wanta - Side bar - Jurors excused - Koppelman request that side bars be put on record - Court grants. Schiek requests short recess to set up video. Court cautions parties not to look at juror's notes while setting up video. Recess 11:24 a.m. 
On record - 11:37 a.m. - Schiek statement as to agreement with Koppelman to mute audio on video - 11:40 - all jurors return State calls Deputy Paul Blondheim/sworn/direct by Schiek - Witness ID's defendant - Koppelman wishes to stipulate to identification of defendant - Court states no question that defendant in court today is same Jason Jones at time of incident - Exhibit 4 (ONSO DVD of squad video) - marked. Video played from beginning until 3:27:55 a.m. 12:12 - Jurors excused for lunch to  return at 1:15 p.m. Recess 12:13 p.m.
Jury trial at 11-18-2015 08:30 am

2:01 p.m. Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states ongoing discussion with counsel. Defendant has case pending in Lincoln County. Koppelman statement. Court sets for jury. Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Reply to Discovery continued

State moves to sequester witnesses - Granted.  State calls T.M./Sworn/Direct by Schiek/Cross by Koppelman.  Defense calls C.R./Sworn/Direct by Koppelman/Cross by Schiek/Re-Direct by Koppelman.
